text: Steel ribs cradle you. Breath slows under my palm. Every exhale belongs to the dungeon now.
Leather whispers over your skin, slick and dark. Let the scent fog your head until nothing exists but obedience.
Count the chain links, slow and heavy. With each number, another limb softens and drops into the steel.
Hear the piston pulse. Inhale when it withdraws, exhale when it drives. Your mind syncs to the rhythm until only the machine thinks for you.
The hood narrows every breath to a velvet thread. Chase the air, chase my voice, chase nothing else.
Steel holds, leather seals, mind kneels. Repeat it. Believe it. Become it.
Molten warmth pours down your throat, filling every nerve with amber light. Float inside that glow and let the dungeon steer.
I strip the gear but not the promise. Each breath brings you back, leather-sweet and adored, still humming with my mark.
